componentConfiguration.title: Accordion
componentConfiguration.paragraph: An accordion is a vertically stacked list of headers that reveal or hide related sections of content.

componentConfiguration.title: Action Sheet
componentConfiguration.paragraph: An action sheet is a modal view that presents choices related to an action people initiate.

componentConfiguration.title: Alert
componentConfiguration.paragraph: An alert gives people critical information they need right away.

componentConfiguration.title: Avatar
componentConfiguration.paragraph: An avatar is a visual representation of a user or entity.

componentConfiguration.title: Badge
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A badge is a small label, generally appearing inside or in close proximity to another larger interface.

componentConfiguration.title: Button
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Buttons give people simple, familiar ways to do tasks in your app.

componentConfiguration.title: Calendar
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The calendar component is used to visually represent a date and allows user to pick a date and navigate between days, months and years.

componentConfiguration.title: Card
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A container for content representing a single entity. E.g. a contact, article, or task.

componentConfiguration.title: Chart
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Graphical representation for data visualization, in which the data is represented by symbols such as bars and lines.

componentConfiguration.title: Chart Stock
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The stock chart visualizes the price of a security over time where time is along the x-axis and the price is on the y-axis.

componentConfiguration.title: Checkbox
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A Checkbox is a control that permits the user to select options. This can be a binary choice, i.e. a choice between one of two possible mutually exclusive options.

componentConfiguration.title: Colors
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Set of Kirby Colors which lets you try out different color combinations.

componentConfiguration.title: Data table
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Data tables allow the us er to show large amount of complex data in tabular form.

componentConfiguration.title: Divider
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The divider is a thin line which is there to visually separate to elements or text.

componentConfiguration.title: Dropdown
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A dropdown hides options by default but can be shown by interacting with a button.

componentConfiguration.title: Empty State
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Empty state occurs when an item og page canâ€™t be shown.

componentConfiguration.title: FAB
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A Floating Action Button performs a most common action on a screen.

componentConfiguration.title: Flag
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A flag is a non-interactive visual indicator to communicate status or other data.

componentConfiguration.title: Fonts
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Kirby font set which shows how to use the font through weight, hierarchy, size and color.

componentConfiguration.title: Form Field
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Form field is a component which is used as an input field for text and data.

componentConfiguration.title: Icons
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Kirbys own icon collection which is constantly growing.

componentConfiguration.title: Item
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The Kirby-item component is a layout which consists of three possible columns.

componentConfiguration.title: Page
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Page is a layout container for a Kirby Page.

componentConfiguration.title: Progress Circle
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The progress circle is a circular progress bar which shows the progression of a task or operation.

componentConfiguration.title: Radio Buttons
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The radio button is a control that allows the user to select one option from a set while seeing available options.

componentConfiguration.title: Range Slider
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Lets users select from a range of values by moving the slider.

componentConfiguration.title: Segmented Control
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Segmented control allows users to make a single selection from a set of options.

componentConfiguration.title: Slide Button
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The slide button is used to verify actions.

componentConfiguration.title: Slides
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Slides make it possible to slide cards or other components horizontally.

componentConfiguration.title: Spinner
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The spinner indicates the loading state of a component or page.

componentConfiguration.title: Toast
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Toast is a non-disruptive message that appears at the top or bottom of the interface.

componentConfiguration.title: Toggle
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Toggle is a control that is used for switching between two possible states.
